Channel's 'cocaine fishermen' prove valuable allies for organized crime
subhead: The arrest of several fishermen in April exposed a trafficking operation that specialized investigators often describe as 'underestimated.' The scheme involves sending small trawlers out to sea to retrieve drugs dropped in the wake of cargo ships.

subhead: The US administration is stopping construction on a nearly completed offshore wind farm, operated by the Danish group Orsted, off the northeast coast of the United States.

title: Libyan coast guards fire on Ocean Viking in international waters
subhead: The humanitarian vessel operated by the NGO SOS Méditerranée came under automatic gunfire from two masked Libyan coast guards for about 20 minutes on Sunday, August 24.

title: SpaceX's Starship completes successful test flight after a year of mishaps
subhead: Elon Musk's company completed the first-ever deployment of a test payload – eight dummy satellites – into space. It was the 10th test for the world's biggest and most powerful rocket, which SpaceX and NASA hope to use to get astronauts back on the moon.

title: French GPs can now prescribe anti-obesity drugs, but not everyone is convinced
subhead: France's medicine safety agency has decided to broaden access to Wegovy and Mounjaro, which are not reimbursed by the French national health insurance, and to lower the obesity threshold required for a prescription. Some medical professionals are concerned that the new rules could lead to misuse.
byline: By Pascale Santi and Camille Stromboni

A portrait of Ukrainian youth living through the war's daily uncertainty
subhead: Taras Fedorenko, a 25-year-old Ukrainian photographer and videographer based in Kyiv, shares with Le Monde the story of a generation striving for a 'normal' life amid the ongoing conflict with Russia.

title: Life in the West Bank settlement of Kedem Arava: 'We're not taking anyone's place, there is only sand around us'
subhead: Established in 2017 near the Jordanian border, the Kedem Arava settlement contains prefabricated homes housing some 60 families, former city dwellers seeking a life closer to nature. While most residents deny ideological motivation, their presence fully aligns with the annexation of Palestinian territory sought by the Israeli far right.

title: US tariffs cast a shadow over Champagne's harvest
subhead: The joint statement published on August 21 by the EU and the US confirms that European spirits are now subject to a 15% import tariff when entering the American market.
